meanings.definition: A Hindu cosmological concept representing a cycle of ages or epochs.
meanings.sent1: In Hindu beliefs, the yugas depict different eras of time.
meanings.sent2: The yugas are believed to repeat in a continuous cycle.
meanings.sent3: During the yugas, the world experiences various stages of spiritual development.
meanings.sent4: The concept of yugas can be seen as the seasons of existence.
meanings.sent5: Learning about the yugas helps understand the cyclical nature of life.

meanings.definition: The four ages of the world in Hindu tradition: Krita, Treta, Dvapara, and Kali.
meanings.sent1: Krita, Treta, Dvapara, and Kali are the four yugas in Hindu tradition.
meanings.sent2: Each of the yugas has its own characteristics and qualities.
meanings.sent3: During the yugas, people believe in the influence of different cosmic energies.
meanings.sent4: The yugas are like chapters in the book of time.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the significance of the yugas reveals profound insights into ancient wisdom.
